authors: S. Basu Roy, G. Das, S. Amer-Yahia, and C. Yu
title: Interactive Itinerary Planning
venue: Proceedings of the 27th IEEE International Conference on Data Engineering (ICDE), Hannover, Germany
abstract: Foundational work establishing interactive itinerary planning as a three-step iterative process with user feedback. Proves NP-completeness of the problem even for simple scoring functions, justifying heuristic approaches. Develops efficient algorithms including GreedyPOISelection and HeapPrunGreedyPOI for real-time recommendations.
key_contributions: Proves NP-completeness of interactive itinerary planning; Develops GreedyPOISelection and HeapPrunGreedyPOI algorithms; Establishes three-step interactive planning framework
algorithmic_approach: Greedy heuristics with heap-based pruning, O(n²) complexity
evaluation_metrics: User satisfaction, computational time, POI coverage
dataset_used: Synthetic POI datasets, real city data
relevance_to_thesis: Essential baseline for thesis - introduces core problem formulation and establishes computational complexity

authors: L. Liao, R. Takanobu, Y. Ma, X. Yang, M. Huang, and T.-S. Chua
title: Deep Conversational Recommender in Travel
abstract: Proposes Deep Conversational Recommender (DCR) system using sequence-to-sequence models with neural latent topics and Graph Convolutional Networks. Enables natural language dialogue for interactive travel planning across multiple sub-tasks including POI recommendation and itinerary planning.
key_contributions: Introduces neural conversational framework for travel planning; Combines seq2seq models with GCNs for POI relationships; Enables multi-task travel planning through dialogue
algorithmic_approach: Sequence-to-sequence with attention, Graph Convolutional Networks
evaluation_metrics: BLEU score, task completion rate, user engagement metrics
relevance_to_thesis: Demonstrates advanced interactive planning approach using modern NLP techniques

authors: A. Yahi, A. Chassang, L. Raynaud, H. Duthil, and D. H. Chau
title: Aurigo: An Interactive Tour Planner for Personalized Itineraries
venue: Proceedings of the 20th International Conference on Intelligent User Interfaces (IUI), Atlanta, GA, USA
abstract: Hybrid approach combining recommendation algorithms with interactive visualization for personalized itinerary creation. User studies demonstrate 70% preference over Google Maps for personalized tour planning. Implements real-time visual feedback for itinerary modifications.
key_contributions: Combines algorithmic recommendations with interactive visualization; Achieves 70% user preference over Google Maps; Implements real-time visual feedback system
evaluation_metrics: User preference ratings, task completion time, usability scores
dataset_used: Paris POI dataset with user reviews
relevance_to_thesis: Shows importance of interactive interfaces for preference-based ranking

authors: M. Xie, L. V. S. Lakshmanan, and P. T. Wood
title: CompRec-Trip: A Composite Recommendation System for Travel Planning
venue: Proceedings of the 27th IEEE International Conference on Data Engineering (ICDE), Hannover, Germany
abstract: Automatic generation of composite travel recommendations with rich GUI for customization. Allows flexible package configuration within cost and time budgets. Integrates multiple data sources for comprehensive travel planning including flights, hotels, and attractions.
key_contributions: Develops composite travel package recommendations; Integrates multiple travel components (flights, hotels, POIs); Provides flexible GUI for package customization
evaluation_metrics: Package quality score, budget adherence, user satisfaction
relevance_to_thesis: Relevant for multi-component itinerary ranking and budget constraints

authors: J. Xie et al.
title: TravelPlanner: A Benchmark for Real-World Planning with Language Agents
abstract: Provides comprehensive benchmark with 1,225 meticulously curated planning queries and nearly 4 million data records. Current language agents achieve only 0.6% success rate, highlighting the complexity of real-world travel planning. Essential benchmark for evaluation.
key_contributions: Creates largest travel planning benchmark with 1,225 queries; Reveals current AI agents achieve only 0.6% success; Provides 4M+ data records for evaluation
algorithmic_approach: Language model agents with planning modules
evaluation_metrics: Success rate, constraint satisfaction, plan feasibility
dataset_used: 1,225 real-world queries across major cities including NYC
relevance_to_thesis: Critical benchmark for evaluating thesis algorithms on real-world data

authors: K. Sun et al.
title: Where to Go Next: Modeling Long- and Short-Term User Preferences for Point-of-Interest Recommendation
venue: Proceedings of the AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence, vol. 34, no. 01
abstract: Advanced neural architecture for POI recommendation considering both long-term preferences and short-term intentions. Directly applicable to ranking itinerary segments by modeling user behavior patterns. Achieves state-of-the-art performance on multiple datasets.
key_contributions: Models both long-term and short-term user preferences; Develops neural architecture for sequential POI recommendation; Achieves SOTA on multiple benchmarks
algorithmic_approach: LSTM with attention mechanism for preference modeling
evaluation_metrics: Precision@K, Recall@K, MRR, NDCG
relevance_to_thesis: Directly applicable to ranking itinerary segments based on user preferences

authors: J. Gu, C. Song, W. Jiang, X. Wang, and M. Liu
title: Enhancing Personalized Trip Recommendation with Attractive Routes
venue: Proceedings of the AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence, vol. 34, no. 01
abstract: Introduces 'Attractive Routes' concept using gravity model in category space. Provides interactive optimization balancing time cost with user experience. Develops novel route attractiveness metrics beyond simple POI coverage.
key_contributions: Introduces gravity model for route attractiveness; Balances time efficiency with user experience; Develops novel attractiveness metrics
evaluation_metrics: Route attractiveness score, time efficiency, user satisfaction
dataset_used: Beijing taxi trajectories with POI data
relevance_to_thesis: Novel approach to ranking routes based on attractiveness rather than just POI count

authors: C. Verbeeck, K. Sörensen, E. H. Aghezzaf, and P. Vansteenwegen
title: A Fast Solution Method for the Time-Dependent Orienteering Problem
abstract: Presents efficient algorithms for time-dependent routing crucial for real-time itinerary ranking. Methods handle varying travel times throughout the day. Directly applicable to dynamic POI scheduling in urban environments.
key_contributions: Solves time-dependent orienteering problem efficiently; Handles real-world varying travel times; Provides fast solution for dynamic environments
algorithmic_approach: Variable neighborhood search with time-dependent costs
evaluation_metrics: Solution quality, computation time, optimality gap
relevance_to_thesis: Essential for handling time-dependent aspects in NYC itinerary ranking

authors: K. H. Lim, J. Chan, C. Leckie, and S. Karunasekera
title: Personalized Trip Recommendation for Tourists Based on User Interests, Points of Interest Visit Durations and Visit Recency
abstract: Comprehensive framework incorporating user interests, POI visit duration patterns, and temporal preferences. Essential for preference-aware ranking implementation. Validates approach on real tourist trajectory data from multiple cities.
key_contributions: Integrates user interests with POI visit durations; Models visit recency for temporal preferences; Validates on multi-city tourist data
evaluation_metrics: Precision, recall, F1-score, tour popularity
relevance_to_thesis: Core reference for preference-based itinerary ranking with temporal aspects

authors: L. Huang, Y. Ma, S. Wang, and Y. Liu
title: An Attention-Based Spatiotemporal LSTM Network for Next POI Recommendation
abstract: Attention mechanisms for capturing user preferences in sequential contexts. Provides neural architecture for learning complex preference patterns. Achieves significant improvements over baseline methods in next-POI prediction.
key_contributions: Develops attention-based LSTM for POI sequences; Captures spatio-temporal dependencies; Improves next-POI prediction accuracy
evaluation_metrics: Acc@K, MRR, distance error
relevance_to_thesis: Neural architecture applicable to learning itinerary preferences

authors: H. A. Rahmani, Y. Deldjoo, and T. di Noia
title: The Role of Context Fusion on Accuracy, Beyond-Accuracy, and Fairness of Point-of-Interest Recommendation Systems
abstract: Addresses fairness and context-awareness in preference modeling. Critical for ensuring equitable recommendations across user groups. Demonstrates importance of beyond-accuracy metrics in POI recommendation systems.
key_contributions: Addresses fairness in POI recommendations; Integrates multiple context sources; Evaluates beyond-accuracy metrics
algorithmic_approach: Context-aware collaborative filtering with fairness constraints
evaluation_metrics: Accuracy, diversity, novelty, fairness metrics
relevance_to_thesis: Important for ensuring fair and diverse itinerary rankings

authors: H.-T. Chang, Y.-M. Chang, and M.-T. Tsai
title: ATIPS: Automatic Travel Itinerary Planning System for Domestic Areas
abstract: Implements automatic preference learning that adapts to user behavior over time. Achieved 82% user satisfaction with gradual profile building approach. Demonstrates practical system for domestic travel planning.
key_contributions: Implements adaptive preference learning; Achieves 82% user satisfaction rate; Builds user profiles gradually
evaluation_metrics: User satisfaction, itinerary quality score
relevance_to_thesis: Shows importance of adaptive preference learning for ranking

authors: C. Liu et al.
title: Spatio-Temporal Hierarchical Adaptive Dispatching for Ridesharing Systems
venue: Proceedings of the 32nd ACM SIGSPATIAL International Conference on Advances in Geographic Information Systems, Atlanta, GA, USA
abstract: Hierarchical adaptive dispatching with real-time spatio-temporal adjustments. Techniques transferable to dynamic itinerary updates. Handles city-scale optimization with millisecond response times.
key_contributions: Develops hierarchical spatio-temporal optimization; Achieves real-time performance at city scale; Adapts to dynamic conditions
evaluation_metrics: Response time, service rate, system efficiency
relevance_to_thesis: Techniques directly applicable to dynamic itinerary updates in NYC

authors: M. Khodadadian et al.
title: Time Dependent Orienteering Problem with Time Windows and Service Time Dependent Profits
abstract: Advanced formulation handling time-dependent constraints and profits. Essential for modeling real-world dynamic conditions. Extends classical orienteering problem with realistic temporal constraints.
key_contributions: Extends orienteering with time-dependent profits; Models service time dependencies; Handles complex temporal constraints
evaluation_metrics: Solution quality, constraint satisfaction, computation time
dataset_used: Synthetic instances based on real networks
relevance_to_thesis: Critical for modeling time-dependent aspects of NYC itineraries

authors: Y. Huang, L. Bian, Z. Li, and M. Zhou
title: Deep Learning-Based Itinerary Recommendation with Queuing Time Awareness
abstract: Incorporates real-time queuing information into recommendations. Crucial for popular tourist destinations with variable wait times. First work to systematically integrate queue predictions into itinerary planning.
key_contributions: Integrates real-time queue predictions; Improves visitor experience at popular sites; Develops deep learning queue model
algorithmic_approach: Deep learning with queue prediction module
evaluation_metrics: Wait time accuracy, user satisfaction, itinerary feasibility
dataset_used: Theme park and museum visit data
relevance_to_thesis: Essential for NYC attractions with variable wait times

authors: A. Chen, X. Ge, Z. Fu, Y. Xiao, and J. Chen
title: TravelAgent: An AI Assistant for Personalized Travel Planning
abstract: Features advanced memory module with continual learning through user interactions. Demonstrates superior performance in dynamic personalization. Implements tool-use capabilities for real-time information access.
key_contributions: Implements continual learning for personalization; Develops memory module for user preferences; Integrates tool-use for dynamic updates
algorithmic_approach: LLM with memory module and tool integration
evaluation_metrics: Task success rate, personalization score, adaptation speed
dataset_used: User interaction logs from travel planning
relevance_to_thesis: Shows importance of continual learning for dynamic preference updates

authors: K. H. Lim, J. Chan, S. Karunasekera, and C. Leckie
title: Tour Recommendation and Trip Planning Using Location-Based Social Media: A Survey
abstract: Comprehensive survey of evaluation methodologies in tour recommendation. Provides taxonomy of metrics and benchmarking approaches. Essential reference for designing evaluation framework for thesis.
key_contributions: Provides comprehensive evaluation taxonomy; Reviews state-of-art in tour recommendation; Identifies key research gaps
algorithmic_approach: Survey and analysis of existing methods
evaluation_metrics: Various metrics across surveyed papers
relevance_to_thesis: Essential survey for understanding evaluation methodologies

authors: H. Werneck et al.
title: Points of Interest Recommendations: Methods, Evaluation, and Future Directions
abstract: Systematic analysis of POI recommendation evaluation methods. Essential reference for designing comprehensive evaluation framework. Identifies gaps between academic metrics and real-world performance.
key_contributions: Analyzes POI recommendation evaluation methods; Identifies gaps in current metrics; Proposes future evaluation directions
evaluation_metrics: Comprehensive metric analysis
relevance_to_thesis: Critical for designing thesis evaluation framework

authors: J. Ruiz-Meza and J. R. Montoya-Torres
title: A Systematic Literature Review for the Tourist Trip Design Problem: Extensions, Solution Techniques and Future Research Lines
abstract: Recent systematic review covering solution techniques and evaluation approaches. Identifies research gaps directly relevant to thesis objectives. Provides comprehensive taxonomy of problem variants.
key_contributions: Reviews recent advances in trip design; Identifies key research gaps; Provides solution technique taxonomy
evaluation_metrics: Analysis of solution quality metrics
relevance_to_thesis: Identifies gaps that thesis directly addresses

authors: D. Gavalas, C. Konstantopoulos, K. Mastakas, and G. Pantziou
title: A Survey on Algorithmic Approaches for Solving Tourist Trip Design Problems
abstract: Foundational survey establishing evaluation criteria for tourist trip design algorithms. Provides comprehensive framework for benchmarking. Reviews both exact and heuristic solution approaches.
key_contributions: Establishes evaluation criteria for algorithms; Reviews exact and heuristic approaches; Provides benchmarking framework
evaluation_metrics: Solution quality, runtime, scalability analysis
relevance_to_thesis: Foundational framework for algorithm evaluation

authors: P. Vansteenwegen, W. Souffriau, and D. Van Oudheusden
title: The Orienteering Problem: A Survey
abstract: Essential mathematical foundations for the Orienteering Problem underlying most itinerary optimization formulations. Comprehensive review of solution methods and applications. Standard reference for problem formulation.
key_contributions: Provides mathematical foundations for orienteering; Reviews comprehensive solution methods; Establishes standard problem formulations
algorithmic_approach: Survey of exact and heuristic methods
evaluation_metrics: Optimality gap, computation time, solution quality
relevance_to_thesis: Core mathematical foundation for itinerary optimization

authors: A. Gunawan, H. C. Lau, and P. Vansteenwegen
title: Orienteering Problem: A Survey of Recent Variants, Solution Approaches and Applications
abstract: Updated survey covering variants directly applicable to dynamic itinerary planning including time-dependent and stochastic versions. Reviews recent algorithmic advances and real-world applications.
key_contributions: Reviews modern orienteering variants; Covers time-dependent and stochastic versions; Analyzes recent algorithmic advances
evaluation_metrics: Performance analysis across variants
relevance_to_thesis: Covers variants essential for dynamic itinerary planning

authors: J. L. Sarkar, A. Majumder, C. R. Panigrahi, and S. Roy
title: MULTITOUR: A Multiple Itinerary Tourists Recommendation Engine
abstract: Algorithm for multiple itinerary recommendations using geo-tagged photos. Demonstrates dynamic sequence-based recommendations. Provides diverse itinerary options based on photo popularity and user preferences.
key_contributions: Develops multiple itinerary generation; Uses geo-tagged photos for popularity; Provides diverse recommendations
algorithmic_approach: Clustering with sequence generation from photos
evaluation_metrics: Diversity score, popularity coverage, user satisfaction
relevance_to_thesis: Relevant for generating diverse ranked itineraries

authors: Y. Kurata and T. Hara
title: CT-Planner4: Toward a More User-Friendly Interactive Day-Tour Planner
venue: Information and Communication Technologies in Tourism 2014, Dublin, Ireland
abstract: Implements collaborative planning through iterative cycles with hot-start mechanisms. Validated through international student user tests. Demonstrates importance of user-friendly interfaces in tour planning.
key_contributions: Implements iterative collaborative planning; Develops hot-start mechanism for efficiency; Validates with international user tests
evaluation_metrics: User satisfaction, planning time, interface usability
dataset_used: Kyoto tourist data with user studies
relevance_to_thesis: Shows importance of iterative refinement in interactive planning

authors: L. Liao, L. Kennedy, L. Wilcox, and T.-S. Chua
title: Crowd Knowledge Enhanced Multimodal Conversational Assistant in Travel Domain
abstract: First multimodal conversational system for travel combining text and image inputs. Advances toward human-like interactive planning assistants. Leverages crowd knowledge for enhanced recommendations.
key_contributions: Develops first multimodal travel assistant; Combines text and image understanding; Integrates crowd knowledge
algorithmic_approach: Multimodal deep learning with knowledge graphs
evaluation_metrics: Response quality, multimodal understanding, user engagement
relevance_to_thesis: Advances interactive planning with multimodal inputs
